types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

fields.name: node

fields.name: outputs
fields.description: Output streams with outgoing events metrics

types.name: DateTime
types.description:
Implement the DateTime<Utc> scalar

The input/output is a string in RFC3339 format.

types.name: EventEncodingType
types.description: Encoding format for the event

types.name: EventNotification
types.description: A notification regarding events observation

fields.name: message
fields.description: The human-readable message associated with the notification

fields.name: receivedBytesTotal
fields.description: Metric indicating bytes received for the current file

fields.name: receivedEventsTotal
fields.description: Metric indicating received events for the current file

fields.name: sentEventsTotal
fields.description: Metric indicating outgoing events for the current file

fields.name: cursor

fields.name: receivedEventsTotal

fields.name: sentEventsTotal

types.name: Float
types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

fields.name: receivedEventsTotal
fields.description: Total received events for the current sink

fields.name: sentBytesTotal
fields.description: Total sent bytes for the current sink

fields.name: sentEventsTotal
fields.description: Total sent events for the current sink

fields.name: receivedBytesTotal
fields.description: Total received bytes for the current source

fields.name: receivedEventsTotal
fields.description: Total received events for the current source

fields.name: sentEventsTotal
fields.description: Total sent events for the current source

fields.name: receivedEventsTotal
fields.description: Total received events for the current transform

fields.name: sentEventsTotal
fields.description: Total sent events for the current transform

types.name: HostMetrics
types.description: Vector host metrics

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional whole numeric values.

types.name: InvalidMatch
types.description:
The pattern matched source(s) which cannot be tapped for inputs or sink(s)
which cannot be tapped for outputs

fields.name: invalidMatches
fields.description: Any invalid matches for the pattern

types.name: Log
types.description: Log event with fields for querying log data

fields.name: componentId
fields.description: Id of the component associated with the log event

fields.name: componentType
fields.description: Type of component associated with the log event

fields.name: componentKind
fields.description: Kind of component associated with the log event

fields.name: string
fields.description: Log event as an encoded string format

fields.name: json
fields.description: Get JSON field data on the log event, by field name

types.name: Matched
types.description: A component was found that matched the provided pattern

types.name: MemoryMetrics
types.description: Host memory metrics

types.name: Metric
types.description: Metric event with fields for querying metric data

fields.name: componentId
fields.description: Id of the component associated with the metric event

fields.name: componentType
fields.description: Type of component associated with the metric event

fields.name: componentKind
fields.description: Kind of component associated with the metric event

fields.name: value
fields.description: Metric value in human readable form

fields.name: string
fields.description: Metric event as an encoded string format

enumValues.name: INCREMENTAL
enumValues.description: Incremental metrics update previous values

enumValues.name: ABSOLUTE
enumValues.description: Absolute metrics set the reference value for future updates

types.name: NotMatched
types.description: There isn't currently a component that matches this pattern

types.name: Notification
types.description: A specific kind of notification with additional details

fields.name: sentEventsTotal
fields.description: Total sent events for the current output stream

types.name: OutputEventsPayload
types.description: An event or a notification

types.name: PageInfo
types.description: Information about pagination in a connection

fields.name: hasPreviousPage
fields.description: When paginating backwards, are there more items?

fields.name: hasNextPage
fields.description: When paginating forwards, are there more items?

fields.name: startCursor
fields.description: When paginating backwards, the cursor to continue.

fields.name: endCursor
fields.description: When paginating forwards, the cursor to continue.

fields.name: health
fields.description: Returns `true` to denote the GraphQL server is reachable

fields.name: componentByComponentKey
fields.description: Gets a configured component by component_key

types.name: String
types.description:
The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8
character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to
represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: StringFilter
types.description: Filter for String values

fields.name: heartbeat
fields.description: Heartbeat, containing the UTC timestamp of the last server-sent payload

fields.name: uptime
fields.description: Metrics for how long the Vector instance has been running

fields.name: receivedEventsThroughput
fields.description: Total received events throughput sampled over the provided millisecond `interval`

fields.name: componentReceivedEventsThroughputs
fields.description: Total incoming component events throughput metrics over `interval`

fields.name: componentReceivedEventsTotals
fields.description: Total received component event metrics over `interval`

fields.name: sentEventsThroughput
fields.description: Total outgoing events throughput sampled over the provided millisecond `interval`

fields.name: componentSentEventsThroughputs
fields.description: Total outgoing component event throughput metrics over `interval`

fields.name: componentSentEventsTotals
fields.description: Total outgoing component event metrics over `interval`

fields.name: componentAdded
fields.description: Subscribes to all newly added components

fields.name: outputEventsByComponentIdPatterns
fields.description: A stream of events emitted from matched component ID patterns

fields.name: swappedInBytesTotal
fields.description: Swapped in bytes total (not available on Windows)

fields.name: swappedOutBytesTotal
fields.description: Swapped out bytes total (not available on Windows)

fields.description: Id of the component associated with the trace event

fields.name: componentType
fields.description: Type of component associated with the trace event

fields.name: componentKind
fields.description: Kind of component associated with the trace event

fields.name: string
fields.description: Trace event as an encoded string format

fields.name: json
fields.description: Get JSON field data on the trace event, by field name

fields.name: node

fields.name: seconds
fields.description: Number of seconds the Vector instance has been alive

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type
validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution
behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally
including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing
additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description:
A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a
__DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description:
One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a
placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned
in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Field
types.description:
Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which
has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description:
Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an
InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and
optionally a default value.

types.name: __Schema
types.description:
A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes
all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry
points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description:
If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will
be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description:
If this server support subscription, the type that subscription
operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds
of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about
that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and
description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface
types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface,
provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose
other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description:
Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid
fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description:
Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are
valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.
